alert.note: Alert for Orleans; St. Tammany (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 24 at 6:02AM CDT until May 27 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 AM CDT THIS MORNING... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of southeast Louisiana and southern Mississippi, including the following counties and parishes, in southeast Louisiana, Orleans and St. Tammany. In southern Mississippi, Hancock and Harrison. * WHEN...Until 645 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 556 AM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 5.5 inches of rain have fallen from thunderstorms overnight since midnight. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain could result in continued minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... New Orleans, Slidell, Bay St. Louis, Waveland, Diamondhead, Pearl River, Stennis Space Center, Pearlington, Lacombe, Kiln, Shoreline Park and Slidell Airport. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
